DOC.brief_title: Influence Hypocaloric Diet Urinary Lithogenic Factors Obese Patients With Kidney Stones
DOC.detailed_description: Objective : evaluate influence low-calorie diet serum urinary metabolic parameter obese adult urinary calculus lithogenic metabolic abnormality . Method : prospective study 50 patient , age 18 year , body mass index 30 kg/m2 , urinary calculus lithogenic metabolic abnormality . Will exclude study patient psychiatric diagnosis depression , patient inability attend clinical follow-up , patient nephrocalcinosis , patient urinary tract infection , patient cystinuria patient subject previous surgery treat obesity . Each patient evaluate monthly day urologist nutritionist . On first evaluation , do anamnesis , anthropometric measurement weight , height , waist , bioimpedance request total serum calcium , phosphate , sodium , potassium , urea , creatinine , uric acid , PTH , pH venous blood , urine test type I , culture urine urine test calcium , oxalate , phosphate , sodium , potassium , citrate , magnesium , creatinine , uric acid , cystine compute tomography evaluation urinary calculus . In second evaluation , 30 day , anthropometric measure repeat , bioimpedance nutritional assessment make recommendation daily ingestion 2500 ml water low-calorie diet 16 Kcal/kg bw/day request total serum calcium , phosphate , sodium , potassium , urea , creatinine , uric acid , PTH , pH venous blood , urine test type I , culture urine urine test calcium , oxalate , phosphate , sodium , potassium , citrate , magnesium , creatinine , uric acid , cystine . Patients monitor monthly 3 month anthropometric measurement , bioimpedance strengthen nutritional recommendation . By end third month , patient submit two series serum urine test diet . The result serum urine test begin dietary treatment compare end treatment Student T test . P < 0.05 consider significant .
